intro: Burchardia umbellata var. ornithogaloides, commonly known as the ornithogaloid bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, elongated berries that mature to a dark purple color. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
